results.title: A Zoo in the trees
results.creator_credit: Louise Jonas, Rob McCubbin and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: The trees which protect us are in imminent danger. If we don’t speak now in defence of our remaining forests, we betray our own future. Judith Wright This program deals with the importance of forest preservation in all parts of the world as they are the life support systems for tree dwelling animals. By saving the trees we are also savings the various species which inhabit them. Groups of monkeys, apes and primitive lemurs at the Royal Melbourne Zoo are intimately observed feeding, caring for their young, grooming and communicating with each other. These primates are contrasted with Australia’s tree dwelling animals, the koala, lace monitor, the grey-headed fruit bat and the green tree frog. Photographed by Frank Few and Rob McCubbin, narrated by Desley Blanch and featuring music composed and performed by Don Burrowes and aboriginal music by the Bwung-Gul Aboriginal Culture Group. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Louise Jonas, Rob McCubbin and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre

results.title: Absolute power
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Karen Spiegel, Malpaso Company and Castle Rock Entertainment
results.brief_description: Absolute Power is a political thriller about a retiring thief who witnesses a murder - by the President of the United States. Fearing that he will be blamed, the thief plans to flee the country - after making amends with his estranged daughter - but decides instead to stay and fight the hypocrisy. Masterfully directed (and starring) Clint Eastwood, this paranoid conspiracy crime story bristles with suspense and features an all impressive cast that includes Gene Hackman, Ed Harris, Laura Linney, Scott Glenn, Dennis Haysbert, E.G. Marshall and Judy Davis.

results.title: Above the timberline: the alpine tundra zone
results.creator_credit: J.V. Durden, Tom Daly, Hugh O'Connor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Remote and baffling except to the most daring climbers, the high peaks are worlds apart where only the most tenacious of living things endure. Forests give way to stunted vegetation and finally to the hardiest of plants adapted to withstand the rigours of bitter cold, glaring sun and tearing wind. The only animals found here are the wild, tough ones such as the mountain goat, elk and bighorn sheep. In true-life colour this film presents an account of life at this specialised level. Film award: Film Survey, Trieste, Italy.

results.title: Above the horizon
results.creator_credit: Hugh O'Connor, Roman Kroitor, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An exciting exploration of the weather and how man may one day learn to control it. For this film a great deal of extraordinary colour footage of the sky was put together, including a demonstration of rain-making. There are views of the geysers of the sun, of bright streamers of northern lights, of wind-stirred clouds, and even the awesome fury of a hurricane. Photography: Jean Roy Awards: Sydney, Buenos Aires, Padua, Canadian

results.title: A Year in Provence
results.creator_credit: David Tucker, Ken Riddington and BBC
results.brief_description: Based on Peter Mayles’ best selling novel, Peter and his wife Annie decide to take “Le Plunge” and abandon the rat-race of England to live in an old farmhouse at the foot of the Luberon Mountains in Provence. Coping with the language and the idiosyncratic behaviour and customs of the locals form the basis of their daily life.

results.title: Above the dust level [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Carla Drago, Kath Shelper, Australian Film Commission and Scarlett Pictures
results.brief_description: Set against a Sydney backdrop, a hypochondriac, her junkie ex-lover and a neighbour with a life threatening illness are united by dust, allergies and disappearing grey Y-fronts. Cast includes Jane Turner, Tobin Saunders and Melinda Dimitriades. (Awards: Winner of numerous awards, including Best Australian Short Comedy Award, MIFF 1999; Highly Commended, Melbourne Queer Film and Video Festival, 2000; Bronze Award, Houston Film Festival, 2000)

results.title: About zoos
results.creator_credit: Christine Z Wiser, N. H. Cominos, Harry Rasky and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Edited from the 1970 television special titled Zoos of the world. Explains that modern zoos around the world provide many services for animals, including places where they can graze, dig, climb, swim and sleep with protection and with nursery and medical care. Suitable for lower and upper primary levels.

results.title: About Schmidt
results.creator_credit: Alexander Payne, Harry Gittes, Michael Besman and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Adapted from Louis Begley’s best selling novel, “About Schmidt” examines an aging man’s ennui whilst seeking to redress the empty vacuum that has become his life. Upon retirement Schmidt discovers that his skills and knowledge are all but redundant as a new breed of company man swiftly supersedes him. At a complete loss, Schmidt decides that one positive action is to prevent the impending nuptials of his only daughter - to a waterbed salesman whom he deeply distrusts and dislikes. Part black humour, part tragi-comedy, “About Schmidt” successes are almost entirely attributable to Jack Nicholson’s winning performance as the embittered and deluded protagonist. One of the most amusing components of the film is Schmidt’s letters of emotional outpouring to a young Tanzanian orphan named Ndugu, whom he sponsors on a whim. These letters reveal Schmidt’s deep-rooted irritation and frustration at the turns his life has taken, his thwarted dreams and suppressed desires. The film is also part road movie as Schmidt embarks upon a trip en route to his daughter’s home - in a monstrous 35-foot Winnebago Adventurer. Whilst “Schmidt” succeeds on many levels, mainly as a fine portrait of a man in crisis, it is also possible to argue that the film fails to sustain its dramaturgical energy and wanes where one expects it to erupt.

results.title: About nothing = O nicem
results.creator_credit: William Bukovy, Pavel Hobl, Jan Brychta, Vlastimil Brodsky, Kratky Film and Vstredni Pujcouna Film
results.brief_description: An unusual animated story about a character called “Nothing”, that teases the mind in a delightful and challenging way. “Nothing” gets into the most difficult situations but - after finding a job in a circus he discovers he can successfully help the sad clown and others become happy and able to make fun again. Note: Czechoslovakian language - no subtitles.
